author: Flo
content:
Oh, Andreas, how much you sound like a kid in a toy store! I too was mesmerized by the iPad - but - well, all the "buts" that you stated applied to my thinking, except, even tho Apple has some business practices that I don't like, I've always had Apple computers. They are so much easier for me to figure out and use than pcs running Windows. 

I think Microsoft is even stinkier in their policies than Apple.  And furthermore, their browsers get attacked all the time. With Apple I don't have to worry about hackers - they just aren't interested. Microsoft is also very short-sighted about what customers want - I've had a WebTV/MSN-TV since 1996, before Microsoft bought and ruined it. But that's another story for another day.

As for Linux, I've never used it as a browser, but my host server runs Linux - don't remember the version, tho. But the server is controlled by a great scripter who knows absolutely what he's doing. We've never been hacked and have never had any problems that were server based. Upstream, yes, but only twice in 6 years.

Oh, you did post an image, right! It's so nice and warm and glowy - but I'm sure the fog was due to some sort of chill in the air, lol. It does look warm and cozy, tho.
